Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to prove the existence of a four-eyed animal in South Sudan.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos used to support the claim are actually artworks created by a Spanish artist named Alvaro Herranz.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the discovery by stating that it is "one of the beauties in Africa," which may not be accurate or supported by evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photos of the artwork represent a real animal discovery, without verifying the authenticity or context of the images.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the photos are artistic creations and not actual evidence of a four-eyed animal.
Falters at times: The claim falters in its accuracy and reliability by using misleading photos and presenting them as evidence of a real animal discovery.
